channel.title: My finished case for Axoloti + AxoControl
channel.description: Hey, I just thought I would post this completed case for the Axoloti and AxoControl board. I started with an existing design which I've modified to be compatible with the Ponoko laser cutting service. I had to use a file to open up the tolerance a little bit, probably because of some shifts when I soldered the pots on, but overall I'm very happy with the result

item.title: My finished case for Axoloti + AxoControl
item.dc:creator: @Olivier Olivier Ozoux
item.description:
@Olivier wrote:

I'm in California, and I have an offer for the east coast.

The two boards together is significantly taller than the Axoloti alone. This case is specifically designed for both.

Read full topic
item.source: My finished case for Axoloti + AxoControl

item.title: My finished case for Axoloti + AxoControl
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

I'll take if you are in Europe?

if not could you post the design...
also is the variation only in the top part of the case? or did you have to raise the sides?

Ive a few of the original design, so I'm wondering for my axo control, if I have to get the whole lot remade, or just the top..

I considered hacking one of the tops, but whilst i think i can get a good finish on the pots/leds I suspect getting the finish around the buttons, and joystick would be tricky to get looking reasonable.

Read full topic
item.source: My finished case for Axoloti + AxoControl

item.description:

item.description:
@Olivier wrote:

Hey, I just thought I would post this completed case for the Axoloti and AxoControl board. I started with an existing design which I've modified to be compatible with the Ponoko laser cutting service.

I had to use a file to open up the tolerance a little bit, probably because of some shifts when I soldered the pots on, but overall I'm very happy with the result
